title: Stuffed Sweet Idiyappam (Sweet String Hoppers)
ingredients: 1 1/2 cup Rice Flour | 2 cups Water (For Boiling) | 1 tsp Ghee | 1 cup Freshly Grated Coconut | 1/2 cup Crushed Jaggery (Or more, as per desired sweetness) | 1 tsp Cardamom Flavoring Substance or 1/2 tsp Cardamom Powder | 2 Keep the measured rice flour ready. | 10 Transfer it into a serving plate. Serve it as a snack or for breakfast.
instructions: 1/2 cup Rice Flour | cups Water (For Boiling) | For the Coconut-Jaggery Filling: | cup Freshly Grated Coconut | /2 cup Crushed Jaggery (Or more, as per desired sweetness) | tsp Cardamom Flavoring Substance or 1/2 tsp Cardamom Powder | First step is to prepare the coconut-jaggery filling. In a mixing bowl, add the freshly grated coconut, crushed/grated jaggery, salt and cardamom flavoring substance or cardamom powder. Mix it well and set it aside. | Keep the measured rice flour ready. | In a kadai add water, salt and ghee. When the water starts boiling, add in the rice flour. Stir quickly till all the water is absorbed. Switch off the flame. Cover and let it rest for few minutes. Transfer it to a bowl. When it cools down a bit, wet your palm with water and knead it. Add little water, if required. Add little ghee and knead till the dough becomes soft. Meanwhile, add water in rice cooker/steamer and let it reach boiling point. | Take idiyappam maker. Brush the inside of the idiyappam maker with oil/ghee. Place the dough inside and start making idiyappam on a silicon mould/butter paper/banana leaves. Place a generous amount of the coconut-jaggery filling over the idiyappam. Again start making idiyappam over the filling. | Place the mould in the rice cooker/steamer. Close the lid and allow it to cook for 18-20 minutes. Remove the mould from the rice cooker/steamer and let it rest for few minutes, before serving. | Alternatively, you can wet your palm and pinch a portion of the rice dough and form it into a ball. Press and form it into a pocket shape. Add a tablespoon of the coconut-jaggery filling. Bring the ends together and form in desired shape. Place it in a silicon mould. | Place the mould in the rice cooker/steamer and steam for 18-20 minutes. Remove the mould from the rice cooker/steamer and let it rest for few minutes, before serving. | Transfer it into a serving plate. Serve it as a snack or for breakfast. | Stuffed Sweet Idiyappam is ready to serve. Enjoy it as a dessert or as a snack or for breakfast.
ingredients_per_person: 1 1/2 cup Rice Flour | 2 cups Water (For Boiling) | 1 tsp Ghee | 1 cup Freshly Grated Coconut | 1/2 cup Crushed Jaggery (Or more, as per desired sweetness) | 1 tsp Cardamom Flavoring Substance or 1/2 tsp Cardamom Powder | 2 Keep the measured rice flour ready. | 10 Transfer it into a serving plate. Serve it as a snack or for breakfast.

instructions: cup Raw rice soaked overnight or for 4-5 hours | cup Boiled cooked rice | cup Freshly grated coconut | /4 tsp Instant yeast | -1/2 cups Warm water | Drain the soaked rice. In a blender, blend together the drained rice, cooked rice, grated coconut, and water (as needed) into a smooth batter. Transfer this into a bowl. Add the remaining water, sugar yeast and mix well. Cover the bowl loosely with a lid and let it ferment for about 5-8 hours or overnight in a warm place until the batter is almost doubled in volume and bubbly. Once ready to make the appams, add salt to the batter and stir gently. | Heat a nonstick appam chatti. Using a ladle, gently pour a scoopful of batter into the pan. Immediately swirl the pan to spread the batter in a flower shape. The batter settles back to the center. Cover with a lid and cook on medium flame till the edges turn golden brown and crisp. Using a nonstick spatula, gently loosen the sides of the appam from the pan and transfer into a plate. Serve crispy appams with egg curry! | Pears as marmalade - a very simple pear jam recipe! | Thai Coconut Pancakes | Cherry bakewell baked oats (vegan) | Hara Bhara Kabab- A veg party starter | Hot-Dogity Sauce | Steak fajitas my way | Chicken and Pineapple | AMAZING! Add the dough to the idiyappam sieve and press it over each mould in the idli steamer in a circular motion. Strings of the dough would fall through the sieve. | Layer the prawn filling on top of the string hopper and top it off with another hopper.

Keep it aside | 3 Pour egg and scramble it until itâ€™s 3/4th cooked | 4 Add chapathi and kuruma/salna. Give it good mix. | 6 Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot! | Chapli kabab Chapli kabab Today I am sharing the recipe of chapli kabab by one of my favourite chefs, the late Chef Zakir. I used to watch his cooking shows and learned a lot. Chef Zakir was an expert on Pakistani cuisine as well as international cuisine. He passed away in April of this year. Chapli kabab are thin ground beef patties made with aromatics and spices. Unlike your usual grilled kababs, Chapli Kababs are fried so theyâ€™re browned on the outside and tender on the inside. Chapli Kabab have a unique flavour, with ingredients like dried pomegranate seeds (anardana) to lend them a slight tang and coarsely ground coriander to enhance their already crispy exterior. Authentic Chapli Kababs are typically a medium to large flat patty, weighing around 75-100 grams per piece. They are typically about 1-2 inches in thickness. One of the characteristic features of Peshawari Chapli Kebab is its traditional cooking technique, which involves shallow (almost deep) frying the kebabs in a pan rather than grilling them. The name â€œchapliâ€ is derived from the Pahto word â€œchaprikh/chapletâ€ which means â€œflatâ€ and alludes to the flat, round and flattened shape of the kabab. Originally a delicacy in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province of Pakistan, in the city of Peshawar, they are now a popular street food and restaurant favourite throughout Pakistan. The dishâ€™s rich history and unique flavor profile make it a favorite among food enthusiasts looking to experience the traditional flavors of the region. #june2026 Sarvat Hanif

title: Kottu parotta chicken
ingredients: 3 Egg | 1 Fry spices,onion,chili & curry leaf. Add shredded parotta. Stir well. | 2 Add chicken gravy with shredded chicken fillet. Stir & mix well. Add salt. Stir. | 3 Make a well in the middle. Add eggs in the middle. Stir and mix well. | 4 Stir well until egg mix well with parotta & well cooked. | California Farm Cod Fish Cheeks California Farm Cod Fish Cheeks Cod fish are large: cheeks are the size of an egg, they are the best part of the fish, fishermen kept this delicacy for themselves. Twelve cheeks make one pound, 2â€ pieces These fish pieces are firmed with a quick salt extraction, rinsed, dried, spiced, then dipped in beer or apple cider rice flour batter, then deep fried. You can apply this recipe to other pieces of thick cod filet: you cut the shape and size of cod cheeks, so the crusts are crispy, the center is medium rare. Hobby Horseman

title: Rice and Stuff
ingredients: 2 cups jasmine rice | 2 envelopes Vigo chicken and yellow rice seasoning | 1 quart beef broth | 3 pounds ground chuck | 1 cup chopped onions | 1 cup fire roasted bell peppers Freezing Fire Roasted Green Bell Peppers | 1/2 teaspoon granulated garlic powder | 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper | 2 cup water | 1 stick butter | 3 Serve I hope you enjoy!!! | Rice Rice This is Alton Brown's recipe and ratios for rice. The rice to water ratios are not as basic as multiplying/dividing by 2. They are listed below. Rice Water ------------------- 1 cup 1 1/2 cups 2 cups 2 3/4 cups 3 cups 3 1/2 cups JoeBagADonuts | Loaded Rice Loaded Rice I love rice but I prefer to add vegetables. This recipe calls for celery, carrots, onions, and hot peppers, but you can substitute any other vegetables. Rice freezes really well so I like to make a big batch and then freeze in 1-2 cup amounts. fenway | Perfect Rice Perfect Rice Indians , Spanish people and Asians eat rice with almost every meal. There are many kinds of rice . Long grains, short grains, brown, white, basmati .. So on. But brown rice is higher in magnesium and other minerals. It also has more fiber. For example, a cup of white long-grain rice contains just one gram of fiber, whereas a cup of brown rice contains four. - But it is so chewy and takes more time to cook. I usually mix them with whites. That the reason you soak them, longer you keep them in water shorter time to cook. I used Goya brand rice. If you make 1 cup rice , use 1 and 1/2 cup of water/ broth. For 2 cups rice use 3 cups of water. .. Rae

title: Basil Yellow Rice
ingredients: 100 gr rice | 150 ml water | 7 cloves shallots | 5 cloves garlic | 2 chilli (if you like spicy, otherwise donâ€™t use it) | 2 tsp shrimp paste | 2 cm turmeric | 1 tsp vegetable oil | 1 tsp chicken stock powder | 15 basil leaves | 5 basil leaves | 2 slices fresh tomato | 1 Cook the rice. Leave overnight in the fridge for the better texture. | 5 Serve with basil leaves on top and sliced tomatoes. Enjoy while itâ€™s hot! | Healthy Herb Yellow Rice Healthy Herb Yellow Rice Turmeric is a delicious wonder herb that NEEDS black pepper to activate. Turmeric has been proved to reduce tumors, aid liver function, help kidneys and all sorts of other good things. Salt is essential to proper body functions. Real butter is healthy. Oregano is a great antioxidant among other things. Parsley is used for healthy blood. I have been eating 2 cups of this daily for my work lunch and the aroma from the lunch room microwave makes others drool! JosiesMom | Yellow Rice with JalapeÃ±os and Tomatoes Yellow Rice with JalapeÃ±os and Tomatoes Turmeric is a powerhouse spice. Adding a little to your rice will add a vibrant yellow tint to it, and it will infuse it with amazing anti inflammatory properties that you will you will relish with every bite. Notes: *I used Jasmine rice, but you can use any rice at hand. Just cook according to package instructions. ** the usual rice- water ratio is 1:2, however, I only used 1 cup and 3/4 of water because of personal preference. If you notice your rice still needs to further cook once the water has evaporated, add the remaining 1/4 cup. #CA2025 Veggie K

ingredients: 1 Marinate the Chicken Thighs for 2-24 hours -1 tbsp olive oil -1 tbsp minced garlic -1 tbsp cumin powder -1 tbsp of paprika -1/2 tbsp black pepper -1/2 tbsp of salt -1/2 tbsp of coriander -1/2 tbsp of cayenne -1/2 tbsp of lemon juice -1/2 tbsp of garlic powder -1/2 tbsp of oregano | 2 For the White Sauce add the following ingredients in a bowl and mix together: -4 tsbp of Mayo -2 tbsp of Plain Yogurt -1 tbsp of Water -1/2 tsp of salt -1/2 tsp of black pepper -1/2 tsp of sugar -1/2 tsp of white vinegar -1/2 tsp of lemon juice -1/2 tsp of parsley flakes | 3 For the Fluffy Yellow Rice: -melt a tbsp of butter in the pot -add 2 cup rice -add tsp of cumin, turmeric, adobo seasoning, paprika -add 1/2 tsp cayenne toast rice with butter and seasonings for 2 minutes -add 2 cups chicken stock/1 cups water bring to a boil. title: Traditional Rice Pudding with Cornstarch and Vanilla
ingredients: 1/2 cup medium-grain rice (about 100 grams) | 2 cups water (about 480 ml) | 5 cups whole milk (about 1.2 liters) | 1/2 cup sugar (about 100 grams) | 2 tablespoons cornstarch (about 16 grams) | 1 teaspoon vanilla extract | 1 Rinse the rice and drain it. | 2 Place the rice in a saucepan with the water and bring to a boil. | 3 Simmer for 10 minutes, until the rice starts to soften. | 4 Add the milk. | 5 Stir well. | 6 Add the sugar and continue stirring. | 7 Add the vanilla extract. | 11 Sprinkle some with cinnamon and leave others plain, according to your preference. Enjoy!

title: Simple and Delicious Rice Pudding
ingredients: 1/2 cup Carolina rice (about 100 grams) | 1 3/4-2 cups water (400-450 grams) | 4 1/4 cups whole milk (1 liter) | 4-5 tablespoons sugar | 1/2 teaspoon vanilla | 4-5 tablespoons cornstarch | 1 Rinse the rice with cold water 2-3 times. | 2 In a pot, bring 2 to 2 1/2 cups of water to a boil. title: Homemade Rice Pudding
ingredients: 1 cup Carolina rice (about 200 grams) | 1 1/2 cups sugar (about 300 grams) | 3 packets vanilla sugar or 3 teaspoons vanilla extract | 5 cups evaporated milk, each cup half milk and half water, or use fresh milk (about 1.2 liters) | 2 tablespoons cornstarch (about 16 grams) | 1 In a pot, add twice as much water as rice. title: Kesar Mewa Sweet Rice
ingredients: 2 cups basmati rice (about 400 grams) | 1 cup milk (about 240 ml) | 1 1/2 cups sugar (about 300 grams) | 4 tablespoons ghee (about 60 grams) | 1/4 cup chopped mixed dried fruits and raisins (about 40 grams) | 1 pinch saffron strands | 2 teaspoons cardamom-nutmeg powder | 1/2 teaspoon yellow food coloring | 6 cups water (about 1.4 liters), as needed | 1 Rinse the basmati rice thoroughly and soak it in water for 1 hour. | 4 In a large pan, heat the ghee. Fry the chopped dried fruits and raisins until golden. | 6 Once cooked, garnish with the fried dried fruits and serve. | Yaksik - Traditional Korean Sweet Rice Yaksik - Traditional Korean Sweet Rice My husband is from Korea and when he called his family in Korea and heard that they were having this special sweet mochi rice during Obon, he really wanted to have it too. So, of course, I decided to make this for him! In Korea, you can also get a sweeter, oilier version. This recipe may also be a bit oily for some people, so I suggest reducing the sesame oil to 1 or 1.5 tablespoons instead. Reducing the amount of salt might also be good depending on your taste. (Recipe by sarahkawa) cookpad.japan

Add the rice to the boiling water and cook until about 85% done. Turn off the heat and drain the water from the cooked rice. | Heat the milk. Add the yellow food coloring, saffron strands, cardamom-nutmeg powder, and sugar. Mix well. | In a large pan, heat the ghee. Fry the chopped dried fruits and raisins until golden. | Add the cooked rice to the pan, pour in the saffron milk mixture, and mix well. Cover and cook until fully done. | Once cooked, garnish with the fried dried fruits and serve.

Now add the fried cashes,kismis,coconut slices,spices powder,a pinch of salt.Mix everything well and add the first extract of coconut milk,boil for 2 more minutes and take out from fire. If the payasam is too thick, you can add a cup or two of dairy milk before adding...

title: Passion Fruit -Uppuma
ingredients: 1 cup Semolina | 1 savala | 1 tsp ginger grated | 1 green chilli | 1 chillie dried red | 2 sprigs curry leaves | 1 tbsp mustard seed | 2 tbsps oil | 4 cups water | 1 no passion fruit | 1 Egg | 1 tbsp black gram (uzhunnu parippu) | 1 tsp salt cashewnuts kismis and (each | 1 Place a thick bottomed thava on the fire.Splutter the mustard seeds in the oil,followed by the black gram(uzhunnu parippu).Now Add the sliced savala,green chillie,ginger followed by the curry leaves and red chillie cut into 2 pieces. | 2 .Add semolina stirring continuously and saute in low fire. When it is moderately fried,add 3.5 cups of boiling water to the above. Add salt,followed by the pulp of the passion fruit and the egg. Stir till everything gets mixed well. | Passion Fruit Syrup Passion Fruit Syrup My friend sends me passion fruit every year from Ogasawara Island so I came up with this recipe to enjoy them. About 30 ml of juice can be extracted from one passion fruit, which will be about 160 ml after filtering. title: Parippu curry annam (dal curried rice)
ingredients: 2 cup cooked rice | 3/4 cup Moong dal | 1 greenchile | 4 red chilies | 1 tbsp fennel seeds | 1/4 tsp asafoetida | 1/2 cup Curry leaves | 1/2 tsp Turmeric powder | 1 tbsp Coconut oil | 1 cup coconut grated | 1 tbsp ghee | 1 Prepare a checklist; keep the required ingredients within reach | 2 Over low heat roast moong in a saucepan until aromatic with a slight change in color. Transfer to a bowl; add 3 cup water, place in a pressure cooker. close the lid. cook for 3 whistles. First whistle over high flame, then reduce cook for 2 more whistle. Turn of the stove. Let the pressure go down. Remove the cooked dal from the cooker on medium high flame boil three cup water in a heavy bottomed saucepan. Add the cooked dal. Reduce the flame to medium low, keep stirring continue to cook, 5min | 3 In a blender make coconut paste with coconut,1tsp fennel, and green chili and 1cup water. Make a smooth paste. Add the paste to the moong mixture in the sauce pan. stir in turmeric powder. continue cooking with simmering heat for 4 minute. Turn off the stove tempering: heat oil in a saucepan over medium low heat. Add fennel, red hot chilies, curry leaves and asafoetida until aromatic, about 2 mins. | 4 Stir in the thadukka in the dal. Add 1tbsp ghee. Dal curry is ready. In a bowl mix the dal curry with rice.

title: Parippu payasam(chanadal kheer)

Keep it little loose as it thickens after cooling. | In a pan add 2 tsp ghee and fry cashews,raisins and coconut chopped for extra flavour and add to kheer.Serve hot.

title: Parippu pradhaman / Chana dal payasam
ingredients: 1 cup chana dal | 2 1/2 cup water | 400 gm jaggery | 1 1/2 cup thick coconut milk | 3 cup thin coconut milk | 1/4 tsp Elaichi(cardamom) powder | 1/2 tsp Roasted jeera(cumin) powder | 1/4 cup coconut bits | 4 tbsp Ghee | 1 Wash and drain the chana dal and roast on low flame till you get a nutty aroma.It took almost 10mins for me.then pressure cook it adding 2.5 cups of water and wait for 4whistles.Once pressure releases mash dal a bit If u want u can mash them completely but I like the bite in them. | 3 Now pour thin coconut milk and wait till it reduces to half the quantity. | 5 Heat 3tbsp ghee in a pan and roast cashewnuts and raisins once done remove keep aside.In the same ghee roast coconut bits till golden brown in colour on low flame.. | 7 Now add a tbsp of ghee and serve hot or chilled ac to ua preference.

title: Parippu payasam(Dal kheer)

Add the first coconut milk and boil for a minute and switch off the flame. | 6 Mix well and enjoy. | 7 Notes: Donot cook on high after 1 st coconut milk is added. just mix well for just a boil and switch off. 2) Take 1 1/2 coconut, grate it finely. In a processor or grinder add the coconut with a cup hot water and process for a minute,then squeeze it for milk. This gives you 1 cup thick milk. title: Parippu Pradhaman

Now add 3 cups of water and boil it; once it starts boiling, reduce the heat and allow to cook till it is half done | 3 Meanwhile melt the jaggery in 2 cup water in a pan over medium low heat and keep on stirring till it is fully melted and reaches 1 string consistency | 7 Switch off, add cumin powder, dry ginger powder and cardamom powder. Mix well. | 8 Finally add the fried cashews, fried raisins, coconut bits and 1/2 tsp ghee.Serve warm or cold | 7 Can Enchilada Soup
instructions: cup Split Moong Dal /Cherupayar Parippu | cup Semi Medium Thick Coconut milk - 2nd extract | /2 cup Thick Coconut milk | /4 tsp Cardamom powder | /4 tsp Ginger powder /Chukku Podi | /4 tsp Cumin powder | tbsp Coconut Pieces (cut into very small bits) | tbsp Ghee /Clarified Butter | Heat ghee in a heavy bottom pan. First fry the coconut pieces until brown and drain on to a paper towel and set aside. Fry the raisins until plump and drain. Add in the cashews and fry until golden brown and set aside | Add the split moong dal and fry for couple of minutes until they turn a little golden brown. Now add 3 cups of water and boil it; once it starts boiling, reduce the heat and allow to cook till it is half done | Meanwhile melt the jaggery in 2 cup water in a pan over medium low heat and keep on stirring till it is fully melted and reaches 1 string consistency | Transfer the cooked mashed dal to a wide-mouthed heavy bottomed pan. Strain the jaggery syrup and add to dal. cook for a few minutes over medium heat. | Add the semi thick coconut milk ; mix well and boil again stirring continuously over medium-low heat for about 8 to 10 minutes or until the mixture thickens. | Finally add the Thick Coconut milk and cook for a minute at low heat and switch off the flame. Keep stirring until the milk is incorporated. Note: Do not boil the coconut milk | Switch off, add cumin powder, dry ginger powder and cardamom powder. Mix well.

title: Kadala parippu pradhaman/Chanadal payasam
ingredients: 1 cup Chana dal | 1 cup Jaggery | 1/8 cup Sago (javvarasi) | 3/4 cup Thick coconut milk | 1 1/2 cup Thin coconut milk (2nd & 3rd extract) | 8 Cashews | 1 tsp Cardamom powder | 1/8 cup Coconut slices | 3-4 tbsp Ghee | 1 In a pressure cooker, pour some ghee and roast chanadal till it becomes golden brown. | 2 Then cook chanadal for one whistle and keep it in low flame for 5mins. | 3 Once the pressure settle down, mash and keep it aside. | 4 In a pan, cook sago till they become transparent. | 5 In a pan/ uruli, melt the jaggery by adding water. | 7 Add 3rd extract coconut milk (munampaal) and cook till it thicken up | 9 Add cardamom powder and thick coconut milk. | 10 Fry cashews and coconut slices using ghee and pour this to the payasam.

Keep stirring in low/medium flame till it slightly thickened. | Add 3rd extract coconut milk (munampaal) and cook till it thicken up | Add 2nd extract coconut milk (randampaal) and cook for few mins. Then switch off the flame | Add cardamom powder and thick coconut milk.

title: Mung Bean Curry
ingredients: A: 1 tsp Turmeric powder | A:1 tsp Chilli powder | A:1 tsp Dhal | A:1 tbsp Sambar podi | B: 2 cloves Garlic | B:1 tbsp Ghee | Quick Dry Curry Starring Beans Quick Dry Curry Starring Beans As I was using pre-cooked beans, I wanted to make something quick! So I chopped the vegetables finely and made dry curry. You can fully enjoy the beans as they are bigger than the other ingredients. Cut the onion, carrot and potato evenly into 5 mm cubes. It tastes nice with corn as well. I recommend using a scum-removal sheet. Using this sheet, you can remove the scum and excess fat easily as the ingredients are very small pieces. Add 2 blocks of curry roux to start, and one more block if it's needed. For 4 servings. Recipe by Muuko cookpad.japan
instructions: A: 1/2 Mung beans soaked overnight | A: 1 tsp Turmeric powder | A:1 tsp Chilli powder | A:1 tbsp Sambar podi | B: 2 cloves Garlic | B:1 pinch Cumin and aniseed | B:3 pcs Dried Chilli | Bring ingredients in A to boil with two cups of water. I took about 1.5 hour on low flame as i wanted the beans and the dhal to be soft that it's mash-able. title: Dal Curry / Yellow Lentils Curry / Sambar
ingredients: 200 g (1 C) chana dhal or yellow lentils | 1 carrot - finely diced | 1 Medium potato - finely diced | 1 brown onion - finely diced | 1 tsp cumin powder | 1 tsp coriander powder | 2 tsp turmeric powder | 2 tsp chicken seasoning powder | 2 tbsp cooking oil | 1 tsp Panch Phoran | 1 sprig curry leaves | 1 shallot - sliced | 3 dried chillies (opt) | 1 . use store bought ready-mixed Panch Phoran or mix a tbsp each of the 5 spices in a bowl. Use a tsp for this recipe | 2 Prepare all ingredients. | Okra(Lady finger) with DaL(Lentil) Curry Okra(Lady finger) with DaL(Lentil) Curry #dalcurry Okra (Abelmoschus esculentus), is known in many countries as ladies' fingers or ochro, is a flowering plant in the mallow family. It is valued for its edible green seed pods. The geographical origin of okra is disputed, with supporters of West African, Ethiopian, and South Asian origins. Raw okra is 90% water, 2% protein, 7% carbohydrates and negligible fat. In a 100 gram amount, raw okra is rich (20% or more of the Daily Value, DV) in dietary fiber, vitamin C and vitamin Ke, with moderate contents of thiamin, folate and magnesium. Today am going to share a delicious recipe with this okra and Lentil. It's a dal curry can be eaten with steamed rice roti or paratha whatever you can. Let's cook ðŸ˜Š. [ Note - Panch phoron is a whole spice blend, used in the cuisine of Bangladesh, Eastern India and Southern Nepal. This goes well with sambar rice and curd rice.

title: Green moong and cauliflower curry
ingredients: 1 cup cauliflower | 1/2 cup green moong dhal | 1/2 teaspoon chilli powder | 1/2 teaspoon Garam masala | 1/2 teaspoon salt | 1/2 teaspoon amchur (dry mango)powder | 1/2 teaspoon dhaniya(coriander) powder | 1/2 teaspoon lime juice | 1/2 teaspoon kasuri methi roasted | 1 chopped onion | 1/2 teaspoon fine ginger garlic paste | 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder | 1/2 teaspoon jeera(cumin seeds) | 1/2 teaspoon saunf(fennel seeds) | 1/2 teaspoon mustard seeds | 2 teaspoon ghee for tadka | 1 Soak the dhal at night and cook till 4 whistles come and then add salt and cool it. Now put ghee in a pan, then mustard seeds cumin and fennel turmeric powder all chopped with half a teaspoon and a pinch of hing onion and cook well with ginger garlic paste. Then add clean cauliflower and cook with salt. Now add the cooked lentils and all the masala and add water and cook it for 5 minutes. Add the flames and roasted Kasuri methi.

title: Green Gram Dhal Curry
ingredients: 1 cup Green Gram | 1 tsp Cumin seeds | 2 Onions (chopped) | 1 inch Ginger (chopped) | 2 chilies Green (chopped) | 2 Tomatoes (chopped) | 1 tsp Turmeric powder | 2 tsps Chili powder | 2 tsps Coriander powder | 1 tsp Cumin powder | 1 tbsp Lemon juice | 2 tbsps Oil | 2 - 3 cups Water (accordingly) | 1 Wash the green gram under running cold water till water runs clear. Soak it in enough warm water for about 1 hour. After soaking, discard the water, add green gram to pressure cooker with salt. | 2 Then add 1 1/2 cups of water to the green gram. Close it with the lid, put the weight on, turn on the heat on high. Let it cook for 1 whistle on high + 10 mins on medium-low. Let the pressure go down by itself and then open the cover. | 6 Then add the cooked green gram and 3/4 cups of water. Mix well and let it simmer for 4-5 minutes. You can adjust the consistency by adding more water or boiling the extra water as per your preference. | My curry Indian Style My curry Indian Style I was really into eating out at Indian restaurants, then I wanted to make a curry myself. I experimented several times to come up with this recipe and it's almost perfect! I put "to taste" for most of the powdered spices. 1 teaspoon is the standard and adjust to your liking. Using the cardamon, cinnamon, nutmeg and black pepper makes the curry richer, but it still tastes good without them. It will taste even better with bone meat. Recipe by Mizukichi cookpad.japan

Eggs are also rich sources of selenium, vitamin D, B6, B12 and minerals such as zinc, iron and copper. White eggs tend to get all the credit when it comes to egg protein. No matter how you cook an eggâ€”poached, omelet, scrambled, fried, and hard-boiledâ€”it will have about 6.3 grams of protein per large egg. This variation of egg curry is made using cauliflower, potato, coconut milk, evaporated low fat milk tamarind water, onion, ginger, garlic, onion and tomatoes along with eggs and that`s how you get the delicious curry. This is the quick meal recipe and a spicy dish too, however, if you wish to make less spicy, you can reduce the birds eye chillies or remove it. Egg curry is a popular Indian curry which is best enjoyed with plain rice or breads. Stay Happy and Stay healthy. SeethihaSNM | Chicken Curry Chicken Curry This is our family's staple curry dish. title: Chicken Kuzhambu (Chicken Curry)
ingredients: 4 . Turmeric powder - 1/2 tsp | 5 . Chilli powder - 2 tsp | 6 . Coriander powder - 1 tbsp | 9 . Garam masala - 1 tsp | 10 . Oil - 2 tbsp | 2 . Fennel - 1 tsp | 3 . Cumin - 1 tsp | 5 . Clove - 3 | 10 . Grated coconut - 1/4 cup | 11 . Oil - 2 tsp | 1 1. Clean chicken thoroughly in running fresh water and cook in pressure cooker with turmeric and salt for 2 whistles. Keep this aside. 2. Heat kadai add 2 tsp of oil and add all the ingredients one by one under the topic "To Grind" except coconut. Saute nicely until tomato get mushy. Once tomato mashed up add coconut saute for 2 min and cool down. Grind to smooth and silky paste with adding bit of water. | 2 3. In same kadai add 2 tbsp of oil. Once hot add this ground paste and saute for 2 minutes. Now add curry leaves this gives nice flavor to the dish. Now add chilli powder, turmeric powder and coriander powder. Mix up and cook till oil come out from the edges. 4. Add cooked chicken with water. Adjust salt remember we already added some salt when we cook chicken. | 3 5. Add 1/2 cup of water and let the curry to boil nicely. Finally add garam masala and coriander leaves. Saute for 2 minutes and serve hot with steamed rice..

title: Fish Curry (Fish Kuzhambu) ðŸŸ
ingredients: 1/2 cup Chopped shallots | 1 Medium size Tomato grounded | 1 lemon size Tamarind(For Kerela style use Kodampuli) | 2 Green Chillies | 8 Garlic pods,crushed | 1 Tbsp Fish curry Masala(any brand) | 1 tsp Red Chilli Powder | 1 tsp Coriander powder | 1/2 tsp Turmeric powder | 1 tsp Pepper Powder | 1/2 tsp Mustard seeds | 1/4 tsp Fenugreek seeds | 1 cup fresh coconut milk | 4 Tbsp Sesame Oil | 1 Wash and clean the fish pieces. | 2 In a vessel add 1/2 cupwater and tamarind and bring it to boil. Once it's cooked turn off the flame and allow it to cool. (If using Kodampuli you can soak it in hot water just 5 mins before adding and then add it to the curry without straining the tamarind). | 3 In a Mudpot add the tamarind extract,chopped shallots, chopped green chillies, ground tomato, crushed garlic, turmeric powder, fish curry masala powder, chilli powder, coriander powder, rock salt to taste, 2 tbsp of oil and water. (You can also skip fish curry Masala. And you can also use Kashmiri Chilli Powder for colour). | 5 After 10 mins add the Fish pieces and cook for 5 mins. If you cook the fish more than 5 mins fish pieces will break. | 7 In another pan for tempering add 2 tbsp oil. Once oil gets heat add mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds and curry leaves. Deviled Eggs were very popular across Europe, but they were still not called Deviled Eggs. It was around the 18th and 19th centuries when the word 'deviling' was being used to describe the process of making a food spicy. In fact, this dish is also known by other names varying from place to place. â€¢ How To Select Eggs For Boiling The size, temperature, and age of eggs all affect how easy they peel after hard boiling. For the best results, we recommend using large eggs straight from the fridge that are a week or two old. Cooking Tips â€¢ Use eggs that are at least â€¢ When boiling, add Â¼ cup of rice vinegar to the pot to keep the egg whites in the shell if the egg cracks while cooking. â€¢ When boiling, add 1 teaspoon of salt to the pot for easier peeling. â€¢ Use a sandwich bag with a corner cut off to cleanly fill the eggs with the yolk mixture. â€¢ Add a tablespoon of softened butter or bacon fat for a more luxurious texture and taste. The mayo will be frothy and ready to use | 4 Boil 2 eggs and peel the shells and set aside | 5 Break the eggs into half. Carefully with a fork take the yolks and keep it in a bowl. | 6 Add salt to the shrimps and cook them in 1 tsp mustard oil. Set aside | 8 Carefully with the fork fill in the eggs and add the shrimps. | 9 Sprinkle paprika and red chilli powder. | 10 Refrigerate for 15 mins and enjoy as an entree | 11 Ready to serve. | Deviled Eggs Deviled Eggs I love deviled eggs. I don't like the overpowering taste of mayonnaise or miracle whip. I use as little as possible to allow the egg taste to manifest itself. For a half dozen eggs (dozen halves), I use about 3 tspns, just enough to bind the filling. Use more if needed for consistency, not all eggs are the same size, and the amount needed may vary a bit. alley927cat | Rosemary Cross-Top Deviled Eggs Rosemary Cross-Top Deviled Eggs The deviled egg can be traced back to ancient Rome, where boiled eggs were seasoned with spicy sauces and served as a starter meal during gatherings and feasts. Deviled Eggs were very popular across Europe, but they were still not called Deviled Eggs. It was around the 18th and 19th centuries when the word 'deviling' was being used to describe the process of making a food spicy. In fact, this dish is also known by other names varying from place to place. â€¢ How To Select Eggs For Boiling The size, temperature, and age of eggs all affect how easy they peel after hard boiling. For the best results, we recommend using large eggs straight from the fridge that are a week or two old. Cooking Tips â€¢ Use eggs that are at least â€¢ When boiling, add Â¼ cup of rice vinegar to the pot to keep the egg whites in the shell if the egg cracks while cooking. â€¢ When boiling, add 1 teaspoon of salt to the pot for easier peeling. â€¢ Use a sandwich bag with a corner cut off to cleanly fill the eggs with the yolk mixture. â€¢ Add a tablespoon of softened butter or bacon fat for a more luxurious texture and taste. Tallior
